did.abstract: The Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation's mill in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, began producing steel in 1886 and had facilities on both banks of the Monongahela River. This collection includes personnel cards for employees of Jones & Laughlin's plant in south side Pittsburgh.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection includes personnel cards for employees of Jones & Laughlin's plant in south side Pittsburgh. These cards include the worker's name, date and place of birth, nationality, race, and wage rate. Payroll information for several departments within the works is also present.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The American Iron Works was founded by John and Bernard Lauth in 1853. Benjamin F. Jones bought into the works and James Laughlin joined his rolling mill with the company to form the Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation. The mill in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, had facilities on both banks of the Monongahela River. The Eliza blast furnaces in Hazelwood were connected to the rest of the mill on the south side by a bridge that transported railcars filled with hot pig iron. In 1974, Ling-Temco-Vought purchased Jones & Laughlin Corporation as part of LTV Steel and all production facilities were closed in 1989.
